title: Aaron Paul makes a stylish entrance at the El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie premiere in Spain
text:
The hotly-anticipated sequel film to Vince Gilligan's hit AMC series was released on Netflix on Friday.

And Aaron Paul stepped out to support El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie's premiere at the Sitges Film Festival in Spain on Saturday.

The actor, 40, looked sharp in a dark blue suit which he paired with a bright yellow shirt as he arrived for the film's photocall at the event.

Handsome: Aaron Paul looked sharp in a blue suit and yellow shirt as he made a stylish entrance at the El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie premiere in Spain on Saturday

Aaron, who reprises his role as Jesse Pinkman in the film, completed his look by stepping out in black suede Chelsea boots, while he accessorised with rings and a silver watch.

Mirroring his onscreen counterpart, he sported a shaved head and a close-cropped beard for a ruggedly handsome look.

The Westworld star put on a very animated display as he made his stylish entrance, posing for photos in front of a Camino and a booth which had the words 'Where is Jesse Pinkman' written across the front in Spanish.

Ever a humble and friendly person, Aaron happily took the time to sign memorabilia for fans inside the festival after discussing the movie.

Back in action: Aaron reprises his role as Jesse Pinkman in the film

Photocall: Aaron posed in front of a booth which had the words 'Where is Jesse Pinkman' written across the front in Spanish

El Camino follows Jesse, now a fugitive from the law, as he tries to put himself back together after being kidnapped by an Aryan Brotherhood gang and escaping with his life following their clash with Walter White.

Fans were besides themselves with happiness over El Camino, and heralded the sequel a 'masterpiece' as they heaped praise on lead star Aaron Paul and the creator.

Those who were lucky enough to see the film as soon as it was released at 8am in the UK, and at midnight in the US, on Friday took to Twitter to gush about Jesse Pinkman's swansong.

Asking fans for their spoiler-free reactions to the film, Netflix received one very succinct response from a fan which read: 'One word: MASTERPIECE.'

Looking good: Mirroring his onscreen counterpart, he sported a shaved head and a close-cropped beard for a ruggedly handsome look

Excitable: The Westworld star put on a very animated display as he made his stylish entrance

Impressive drama: El Camino follows Jesse, now a fugitive from the law, as he tries to put himself back together after being kidnapped by an Aryan Brotherhood gang and escaping

Sweet: Ever a humble and friendly person, Aaron happily took the time to sign memorabilia for fans inside the festival after discussing the movie

One fan gushed over Vince's incredible storytelling, as they wrote: 'EL CAMINO is the Jesse Pinkman epilogue I didn't need but always wanted and can't believe we got.'

Another viewer called for the creator to receive the highest award in showbiz, as they declared: 'Nominate Vince Gilligan for a Best Original Screenplay Oscar you f****** cowards.'

In a gushing tribute, another fan wrote: 'The heartwarming closure to character that we never thought we'd get. Absolutely brilliant and captivating thought it all. Thank you Vince Gilligan. Thank you Jesse Pinkman. Thank you Aaron Paul most of all. Forever grateful for this story.'

Delighted: Those who were lucky enough to see the film as soon as it was released at 8am in the UK, and at midnight in the US, on Friday took to Twitter to gush about the film

Sharp: Aaron completed his look by stepping out in black suede Chelsea boots, while he accessorised with rings and a silver watch

Blown away: Asking fans for their spoiler-free reactions to the film, Netflix received several responses from fans, all of which praised Aaron's performance and Vince's excellent story

Sensational: One very succinct response from a fan claimed it was a 'MASTERPIECE'

Breaking Bad followed dejected high-school chemistry teacher Walter White (Bryan Cranston), who decides to start making Crystal Meth with his former student Jesse, after he was diagnosed with lung cancer.

Originally intending to make money as a way to pay for his treatment and support his family, Walt soon loses himself to the apparent advantages of criminal life and soon becomes a drug lord known by the pseudonym Heisenberg.

During its five year run on AMC from 2008-2013, the series earned 16 Prime Time Emmy wins and 58 nominations as well as two Peabody Awards.

While it has already spawned successful spin off series Better Call Saul starring Bob Odenkirk, the new movie El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie is a direct sequel that picks up straight after the series' conclusion.

El Camino is out now in select cinemas and on Netflix.
